statement.p: A man owns stock valued at 2,100.00. One day the stock drops by 9, and the next day the gain is the same percentage. How much money is the stock valued at the end of the second day?

solution.p: We can calculate in two steps. First, the decrease on the first day is \displaystyle\${2},{100.00}\cdot{0.09}=\${189.00}. This means the value at the end of day 1 is \displaystyle\${2},{100.00}-\${189.00}=\${1},{911.00}.

Second the increase on the second day is \displaystyle\${1},{911.00}\cdot{0.09}=\${171.99}. Notice that we are calculating the percent based on the first days result, not the original amount. The amount at the end of the second day is \displaystyle\${1},{911.00}+\${171.99}=\${2},{082.99}.
